Title: Reduced pricing for GitHub-hosted runners usage
EnhancedContent:
Reduced costs for GitHub-hosted runners are now in effect. We [announced this update](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-12-16-coming-soon-simpler-pricing-and-a-better-experience-for-github-actions/) on December 16, 2025. GitHub users will see price reductions of up to 39% for GitHub-hosted runners, [depending on the machines](https://docs.github.com/billing/reference/actions-runner-pricing) they use.

Standard hosted runner usage in public repositories remains free.

### Recommended resources

- For full details regarding GitHub Actions pricing changes, see the [Executive Insights post](https://resources.github.com/actions/2026-pricing-changes-for-github-actions).
- See [runner pricing documentation](https://docs.github.com/billing/reference/actions-runner-pricing) for adjusted GitHub-hosted runner rates.
- For help estimating your expected Actions usage cost, see the [Actions pricing calculator](https://github.com/pricing/calculator#actions).
- For more details on upcoming GitHub Actions releases, see the [GitHub public roadmap](https://github.com/orgs/github/projects/4247).
Author: Allison
